premises: The interest rate rises or the stock market falls but not both at the same time
The interest rate does not rise
conclusions: If the stock market does not fall, then the interest rate rises
incorrect conclusions: The stock market does not fall
If the interest rate rises, then the stock market falls
If the stock market falls, then the interest rate rises

premises: There is increased consumer spending or there is a recession but not both at the same time
There is no increased consumer spending
conclusions: If there is not a recession, then there is increased consumer spending
incorrect conclusions: If there is increased consumer spending, then there is a recession
If there is a recession, then there is increased consumer spending

premises: The unemployment rate decreases or inflation increases but not both at the same time
The unemployment rate does not decrease
conclusions: If inflation does not increase, then the unemployment rate decreases
incorrect conclusions: If the unemployment rate decreases, then inflation increases
If inflation increases, then the unemployment rate decreases
